page.title: 19HISTORY OF BRIERTON
page.content: In 1938 a mammoth bone was found at Brierton Quarry, only one year after men digging for sand had discovered Saxon graves. No record of Brierton appeared in the Domesday Book.However a survey of 1543 showed Brierton surrounded by Dalton & Tunstall to the north, Owton to the east and Stotfold to the west. The survey also shows the 3 Field System in operation. The farms were later rented and from 1700 the rents were used to support Kirkleatham School near Redcar. About this time the 3 Field System disappeared and today's 3 farms were created. Since that time new houses and bungalows have been built but the basic character of the area has changed very little, despite the enormous growth of nearby Hartlepool.
